column4: Airbus sprints from behind in bid to upset Boeing order lead

column4: Breakingviews - Icahn wins SandRidge battle but war isn’t over
column5: DALLAS (Reuters Breakingviews) - Carl Icahn has won his first battle with SandRidge Energy  but the war is not yet over. The oil driller has dropped its $746 million bid for rival Bonanza Creek Energy  something the activist and others wanted. But its poison pill – which bars Icahn from upping his stake and makes a takeover more difficult – remains in place.

column4: Breakingviews - Goldman loses on tax swings  gains on roundabouts
column5: NEW YORK (Reuters Breakingviews) - Goldman Sachs is going to lose on the swings but gain on the roundabouts as a result of President Donald Trump’s tax reforms. The Wall Street firm will book a $5 billion charge in the fourth quarter  it said on Thursday  two-thirds of it from a new levy on the $31 billion or so earnings it holds abroad. Yet that should be more than offset by other goodies  notably a significantly lower corporate tax rate.

column4: UPDATE 2-Goldman to take one-time $5 bln hit to profit from new tax law
column5: Dec 29 Goldman Sachs Group Inc said on Friday it expects fourth-quarter earnings to decrease by about $5 billion  as the bank looks to take advantage of a new tax law that makes it cheaper for U.S. companies to repatriate profits.

column4: UPDATE 1-Russia's Mechel says has enough creditor support for restructure of $1 bln loan
column5: MOSCOW  Dec 29 Russian coal and steel producer Mechel said on Friday that talks with banks on restructuring a $1 billion syndicated loan had concluded successfully.

column4: Russia's Mechel says talks with banks on restructuring $1 bln syndicated loan successful
column5: MOSCOW  Dec 29 Russian coal and steel producer Mechel said on Friday that talks with banks on a restructuring of a $1 billion syndicated loan had concluded successfully. (Reporting by Polina Devitt; Writing by Andrey Ostroukh; Editing by Susan Fenton)

column4: Mechel says CFO to leave company
column5: MOSCOW  Dec 29 Russian coal and steel producer Mechel's Chief Financial Officer Sergey Rezontov is to step down for personal reasons  the company said in a statement on Friday.

column4: Brazilian regulator accuses Petrobras ex-executives of graft
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's securities regulator formally accused eight former executives of state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA of corruption on Friday  as the world's largest graft investigation stretches deep into its third year.

column4: Brazilian regulator accuses Petrobras ex-executives of graft
column5: SAO PAULO  Dec 29 Brazil's securities regulator formally accused eight former executives of state-run oil company Petroleo Brasileiro SA of corruption on Friday  as the world's largest graft investigation stretches deep into its third year.

column4: Brazil imports of refined products to hit at least 17-year high in 2017
column5: RIO DE JANEIRO  Dec 29 Brazil will import more refined oil products this year than any other since records began in 2000  as state-controlled oil giant Petroleo Brasileiro loses market share to private firms.

column4: Pipeline projects move ahead to tackle rising Texas shale output
column5: HOUSTON  Dec 29 Several oil pipeline companies this month agreed to move ahead on multi-billion-dollar projects that would link Texas shale fields to Gulf Coast export hubs  offering new outlets for burgeoning output expected in 2018.

column4: Small RBS investors renew push to set up shareholder committee
column5: LONDON  Dec 29 Small investors in Royal Bank of Scotland are launching a second attempt to force the state-backed lender to set up a shareholder committee to improve corporate governance after a first bid failed earlier this year.

column4: Breakingviews - Icahn wins SandRidge battle but war isn’t over
column5: DALLAS (Reuters Breakingviews) - Carl Icahn has won his first battle with SandRidge Energy  but the war is not yet over. The oil driller has dropped its $746 million bid for rival Bonanza Creek Energy  something the activist and others wanted. But its poison pill – which bars Icahn from upping his stake and makes a takeover more difficult – remains in place.

column4: Pershing Square  Valeant arrive at settlement split for Allergan lawsuit
column5: Activist investor William Ackman's Pershing Square  and Valeant Pharmaceuticals  on Friday decided to pay $290 million to settle a lawsuit that accused them of insider trading before bidding for Allergan Plc  in 2014.

column4: UPDATE 1-Pershing Square  Valeant arrive at settlement split for Allergan lawsuit
column5: Dec 29 Activist investor William Ackman's Pershing Square and Valeant Pharmaceuticals on Friday decided to pay $290 million to settle a lawsuit that accused them of insider trading before bidding for Allergan Plc in 2014.

column4: Pershing Square and Valeant reach agreement on settlement split
column5: Dec 29 Activist investor William Ackman's Pershing Square said on Friday it had reached an agreement with Valeant Pharmaceuticals to split settlement costs of a lawsuit related to Allergan Plc.

column4: CEOs go M&A hunting as booming markets unleash dealmaking spirits
column5: NEW YORK/LONDON  Dec 28 Mergers and acquisitions had another strong year in 2017  reaching their third highest annual level since the 2008 financial crisis  as CEOs were emboldened by buoyant markets to pursue transformative deals  even when their targets resisted.
